. The data in Table 2 shows that the spin state of both the oxidized ([Cu III(acac) 2] +) and reduced ([Cu I(acac) 2] -) molecules is zero (closed shell singlets), therefore no unpaired electrons exist in either of these forms. Also shown in Fig. 4, are the Kohn-Sham MO energy level diagrams (in eV) of the reduced molecule ([Cu I(acac) 2] -, left diagram) and oxidized molecule ([Cu III(acac) 2] +, right diagram), which illustrate the change both in electron occupation, as well as in frontier molecular orbital energies, during reduction and oxidation of [Cu(acac) 2] respectively. The Cu-d-based antibonding orbitals of all three forms of [Cu II(acac) 2], namely the reduced (anion), neutral and oxidized (cation) forms, are shown in Fig. 5.
